intro: Deyeuxia plebeia, commonly known as the common sedge, is a perennial grass-like plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its triangular, ridged stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. This plant typically grows in wet or marshy environments, often forming dense mats in wetlands and along the edges of ponds. Deyeuxia plebeia is widely distributed across temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
